content: I didn't know Shep is a southpaw. Can't say that I ever watched him but a neutral commentator would serve us best. Making statements that we do not hold people is far from fact. WWII in parts of Germany Japan, Philippines, and various other countrys the rule of law was not enacted right away. In fact in the Philippines during Americas occcupation we held massive amounts of people in concertration camps. Of course the famous Lincoln signature on arrest warrants and thousands being held without any rights, all the way back to John Adams and the Alien Sedition Act. FDR with Japanese spies in Hawaii, as well as thousands on the mainline, cousin Teddy (the Panama canal), Truman, (German sabotuers, Unions 1946) and literally hundreds of events and some of the most beloved Presidents we've seen. Habeas was not meant for a non-american, from a battlefield on the other side of the world, or those that create death and distruction heeped high on New York City streets. Now it's time for Geneva. Laws are made by those living a civilized world. Not those that are savage and takes advantage of the naive.
